00062 /*
00063  * The macros cvmx_likely and cvmx_unlikely use the
00064  * __builtin_expect GCC operation to control branch
00065  * probabilities for a conditional. For example, an "if"
00066  * statement in the code that will almost always be
00067  * executed should be written as "if (cvmx_likely(...))".
00068  * If the "else" section of an if statement is more
00069  * probable, use "if (cvmx_unlikey(...))".
00070  */
00071 #define cvmx_likely(x)      __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
00072 #define cvmx_unlikely(x)    __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
00073 
00074 #if CVMX_ENABLE_DEBUG_PRINTS
00075 #define cvmx_dprintf        printf
00076 #define cvmx_dvprintf       vprintf
00077 #else
00078 static inline void cvmx_dvprintf(const char __attribute__ ((unused)) *format, va_list __attribute__ ((unused)) ap)
00079 {
00080     /* Prints are disbled, do nothing */
00081 }
00082 
00083 static inline void cvmx_dprintf(const char *format, ...) __attribute__ ((format(printf, 1, 2)));
00084 static inline void cvmx_dprintf(const char __attribute__ ((unused)) *format, ...)
00085 {
00086     /* Prints are disbled, do nothing */
00087 }
00088 #endif

00090 #define cvmx_printf        printf
00091 #define cvmx_vprintf       vprintf

00093 /**
00094  * Convert a pointer to a field to a pointer to the enclosing structure.
00095  *
00096  * @param _p A pointer to a strucure field.
00097  * @param _t The type of the enclosing structure.
00098  * @param _m The field name (of _p) in the enclosing structure.
00099  *
00100  * @return A pointer to the enclosing object of type _t.
00101  */
00102 #define CVMX_CONTAINTER_OF(_p, _t, _m) ({       \
00103     const typeof(((_t *)0)->_m) *__mp = (_p);   \
00104     (_t *)((char *)__mp - offsetof(_t, _m));})
00105 
00106 #define CAST64(v) ((long long)(long)(v))    // use only when 'v' is a pointer
00107 #define CASTPTR(type, v) ((type *)(long)(v))
00108 
00109 #define CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE    (128)   // In bytes
00110 #define CVMX_CACHE_LINE_MASK    (CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE - 1)  // In bytes
00111 #define CVMX_CACHE_LINE_ALIGNED __attribute__ ((aligned (CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE)))
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * This macro spins on a field waiting for it to reach a value. It
00115  * is common in code to need to wait for a specific field in a CSR
00116  * to match a specific value. Conceptually this macro expands to:
00117  *
00118  * 1) read csr at "address" with a csr typedef of "type"
00119  * 2) Check if ("type".s."field" "op" "value")
00120  * 3) If #2 isn't true loop to #1 unless too much time has passed.
00121  */
00122 #define CVMX_WAIT_FOR_FIELD64(address, type, field, op, value, timeout_usec)\
00123     ({int result;                                                       \
00124     do {                                                                \
00125         uint64_t done = cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) + (uint64_t)timeout_usec * \
00126                         cvmx_clock_get_rate(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) / 1000000; \
00127         type c;                                                         \
00128         while (1)                                                       \
00129         {                                                               \
00130             c.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(address);                             \
00131             if ((c.s.field) op (value)) {                               \
00132                 result = 0;                                             \
00133                 break;                                                  \
00134             } else if (cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) > done) {  \
00135                 result = -1;                                            \
00136                 break;                                                  \
00137             } else                                                      \
00138                 cvmx_wait(100);                                         \
00139         }                                                               \
00140     } while (0);                                                        \
00141     result;})
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * This macro spins on a field waiting for it to reach a value.  It
00145  * is common in code to need to wait for a specific field in a CSR
00146  * to match a specific value.  Conceptually this macro expands to:
00147  *
00148  * 1) read csr at "address" with a csr typedef of "type"
00149  * 2) Check if ("type".s."field" "op" "value")
00150  * 3) If #2 isn't true loop to #1 unless too much time has passed.
00151  */
00152 #define CVMX_WAIT_FOR_FIELD64_NODE(node, address, type, field, op, value, timeout_usec)\
00153     ({int result;                                                           \
00154     do {                                                                \
00155         uint64_t done = cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) + (uint64_t)timeout_usec * \
00156         cvmx_clock_get_rate(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) / 1000000; \
00157         type c;                                                         \
00158         while (1)                                                       \
00159         {                                                               \
00160             c.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, address);                  \
00161             if ((c.s.field) op (value)) {                               \
00162             result = 0;                                             \
00163             break;                                                  \
00164         } else if (cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) > done) {  \
00165             result = -1;                                            \
00166             break;                                                  \
00167         } else                                                      \
00168             cvmx_wait(100);                                         \
00169         }                                                               \
00170     } while (0);                                                        \
00171     result;})
00172 
00173 #define CVMX_BUILD_ASSERT_ZERO(e)    (sizeof(struct {int __static_assert:(e)?1:-1;}))
00174 #define CVMX_BUILD_ASSERT(condition) ((void)CVMX_BUILD_ASSERT_ZERO(condition))

00176 /**
00177  * Builds a bit mask given the required size in bits.
00178  *
00179  * @param bits   Number of bits in the mask
00180  * @return The mask
00181  */
00182 static inline uint64_t cvmx_build_mask(uint64_t bits)
00183 {
00184     if (bits == 64)
00185         return -1;
00186 
00187     return ~((~0x0ull) << bits);
00188 }
00189 
00190 /**
00191  * Extract bits out of a number
00192  *
00193  * @param input  Number to extract from
00194  * @param lsb    Starting bit, least significant (0-63)
00195  * @param width  Width in bits (1-64)
00196  *
00197  * @return Extracted number
00198  */
00199 static inline uint64_t cvmx_bit_extract(uint64_t input, int lsb, int width)
00200 {
00201     uint64_t result = input >> lsb;
00202     result &= cvmx_build_mask(width);
00203     return result;
00204 }
00205 
00206 /**
00207  * Extract a signed magnitude value. Signed magnitude is a value where the MSB
00208  * is treated as a sign bit, not like the mornal twos compliment.
00209  *
00210  * @param input  Number to extract from
00211  * @param lsb    Starting bit, least significant (0-63)
00212  * @param msb    which is the signed bit
00213  *
00214  * @return Extracted number
00215  */
00216 static inline int64_t cvmx_bit_extract_smag(uint64_t input, int lsb, int msb)
00217 {
00218     int64_t result = cvmx_bit_extract(input, lsb, msb - lsb);
00219     if (input & (1ull << msb))
00220         result = -result;
00221     return result;
00222 }
00223 
00224 /**
00225  * Insert bits into a number
00226  *
00227  * @param original Original data, before insert
00228  * @param input    Data to insert
00229  * @param lsb    Starting bit, least significant (0-63)
00230  * @param width  Width in bits (1-64)
00231  *
00232  * @return Number with inserted bits
00233  */
00234 static inline uint64_t cvmx_bit_insert(uint64_t original, uint64_t input, int lsb, int width) __attribute__((always_inline));
00235 static inline uint64_t cvmx_bit_insert(uint64_t original, uint64_t input, int lsb, int width)
00236 {
00237     uint64_t mask = cvmx_build_mask(width);
00238     uint64_t result = original & ~(mask << lsb);
00239     result |= (input & mask) << lsb;
00240     return result;
00241 }
00242 
00243 /**
00244  * Builds a memory address for I/O based on the Major and Sub DID.
00245  *
00246  * @param major_did 5 bit major did
00247  * @param sub_did   3 bit sub did
00248  * @return I/O base address
00249  */
00250 static inline uint64_t cvmx_build_io_address(uint64_t major_did, uint64_t sub_did)
00251 {
00252     return ((0x1ull << 48) | (major_did << 43) | (sub_did << 40));
00253 }
00254 
00255 /**
00256  * Perform mask and shift to place the supplied value into
00257  * the supplied bit rage.
00258  *
00259  * Example: cvmx_build_bits(39,24,value)
00260  * <pre>
00261  * 6       5       4       3       3       2       1
00262  * 3       5       7       9       1       3       5       7      0
00263  * +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+------+
00264  * 000000000000000000000000___________value000000000000000000000000
00265  * </pre>
00266  *
00267  * @param high_bit Highest bit value can occupy (inclusive) 0-63
00268  * @param low_bit  Lowest bit value can occupy inclusive 0-high_bit
00269  * @param value    Value to use
00270  * @return Value masked and shifted
00271  */
00272 static inline uint64_t cvmx_build_bits(uint64_t high_bit, uint64_t low_bit, uint64_t value)
00273 {
00274     return ((value & cvmx_build_mask(high_bit - low_bit + 1)) << low_bit);
00275 }
00276 
00277 /**
00278  * Return the number of cores available in the chip
00279  *
00280  * @return
00281  */
00282 static inline uint32_t cvmx_octeon_num_cores(void)
00283 {
00284     uint64_t ciu_fuse;
00285     ciu_fuse = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_CIU_FUSE) & 0xffffffffffffull;
00286     return cvmx_dpop(ciu_fuse);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /**
00290  * Return the number of cores available in the chip
00291  *
00292  * @param node OCX node number
00293  *
00294  * @return
00295  */
00296 static inline uint32_t cvmx_octeon_num_cores_node(int node)
00297 {
00298     uint64_t ciu_fuse;
00299     ciu_fuse = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_CIU_FUSE) & 0xffffffffffffull;
00300     return cvmx_dpop(ciu_fuse);
00301 }
00302 
00303 /**
00304  * Return true if Octeon is CN36XX
00305  *
00306  * @return
00307  */
00308 static inline int cvmx_octeon_model_CN36XX(void)
00309 {
00310     return (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN38XX)
00311         && cvmx_fuse_read(264));
00312 }
